name: perspicaciously
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that shows skill in noticing, understanding, or judging things accurately: He writes perspicaciously about the position of women in medieval society. "Do you have another reason for wanting to go?" asked my aunt perspicaciously.
More examplesFewer examplesThe article rather perspicaciously points to the true causes of the conflict.He perspicaciously predicted that the success or failure of the project would rest on the events of the next 24 hours.She first came across the material in the 1950s, and perspicaciously noted its potential.
